result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles A Christopherson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

On one or more other charges, Charles A Christopherson was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Charles A Christopherson is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court Commissioner Wright Laufenberg presides. Defendant, Charles A. Christopherson does not appear. Nancy Bergstrom appeared for the Lincoln County. Case called at 2:50. County heard. Court enters default judgment in favor of County due to non-appearance, court makes finding of contempt, orders lump sum payment in the amount of $665.00 to be paid no later than June 11, 2018 at 4 pm, entry into a payment plan in the amount of $100 per month beginning on July 16, 2018 and every month thereafter until balance is paid in full. Court further orders 30 days jail STAYED w/Huber for failure to comply with lump sum payment and/or payment plan. Jail as sanction does not satisfy balance.
Notice and Order to Show Cause
Motion for Contempt and to Impose Sanctions

Defendant Charles A Christopherson in court with attorney James A. Wedemeyer.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 4:28pm On record - Arguments by Zengler/Wedemeyer - Court will not allow 4 or 5 different incidents be testified to - Officer Borchardt will be allowed to answer question - 4:34pm jurors present - Officer Borchardt recalled and resumes stand and answers question - 4:36pm Defendant called - Sworn - Direct by Wedemeyer - 4:55pm  Cross by Zengler - 5:05pm No juror questions - 5:05pm Rebuttal witness Officer Mathwick called - Sworn - Direct by Zengler - Cross by Wedemeyer - Redirect by Zengler - Recross by Wedemeyer - 5:12pm Officer exits courtroom - 5:12pm Officer Borchardt resumes stand, advised still under oath - Direct by Zengler - 5:16pm Cross by Wedemeyer - Attorney Zengler apologizes to Attorney Wedemeyer for behavior - Juror question - Additional juror question - 5:29pm Sidebar - Court reporter stopped conversation between Officer and Juror during side bar - Statements by counsel - Evidence is in and court will review instructions with counsel - Court brings up discussion between Officer and Juror and questions Officer Borchardt regarding issue - 5:39pm  Attorney Wedemeyer recalls defendant and is reminded he is still under oath - Direct by Wedemeyer - Cross by Zengler -5:42pm  Officer Mathwick recalled - Direct by Zengler - Cross by Wedemeyer - 5:44pm Officer Pete Borchardt recalled - Direct by Zengler -Cross by Wedemeyer - 5:45pm Jury exits - Off record 6:32pm On record - Jury instruction changes put on record - 6:36pm jurors present -  Jury instructions given - 6:50pm  Closing arguments by Zengler - 6:59pm Closing arguments by Wedemeyer - Exhibit's #1, #2, #3 published to the jury - 7:13 pm Rebuttal by Zengler - 7:24pm Court advises jurors of verdict forms - 7:27pm Bailiffs sworn - 7:29pm Jurors exit - Deliberations begin -
8:25pm On record - Question by jurors (In writing) - Statements by counsel - Court will instruct jurors to continue deliberations - Sidebar from 5:28pm put on record at this time - Court brings up point of doors being locked from 4:30pm - 6:00pm Clerk opened at recess - 8:36pm Off record
9:23pm Note received from foreperson - Court will give 520 instruction - 9:30pm Jurors present - Court gives the 520 instruction - 9:32pm Jurors resume deliberations
9:55pm Jurors have reached a verdict - 9:57pm Jury present - juror 2010 is the foreperson - Court finds defendant Not Guilty -
#1 marked (photo of entrance); #2 marked (form regarding use of force - borchardt)  both are offered and received.  #3 marked (form regarding use of force - mathwich) offered and received.

Defendant Charles A Christopherson in court with attorney James A. Wedemeyer.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  State's motion to sever charges.  The victim in the case is not present (CMC).  Defense wants to dismiss.  State objects.  Arguements heard.  Court gives the parties options as to what could happen.  Court does not feel we can proceed with jury selection without know which way the trial is going to proceed.  Court to take a 10 minute recess for the parties to talk.  Back on the record at 9:06 am.  State informs the court that they do not want to adjourn.  State is willing to dismiss charge that involues the missing victim. The officer(victim) in count 3 would like a speedy disposition of this case. Defense addresses the court as to how they want this to go.  Arguements heard.  Court rules to deny motion to sever charges.  State moves to dismiss Count 1 w/o prejudice.  Court grants this request.  State would like to set time limits for the opening and closing statements.  Court grants this request.  The trial will go forward in regards to Count 3.  Sidebar at 1:57 pm - regarding the placement of the brief case and defense attorney tripping over it.  Jurors excused for a short break at 2:16 pm.  Court addresses the party to stay on task.  Juror back after break at 2:33 pm.

Jury selection began at 10:05 am; First oath was given to the jurors at 10:10 am; Second oath given to the selected jurors at 10:57 am.  Jury selection is comlete at 10:59 am.  Court takes a 15 min break.  Back on the record at 11:15 am.  

Back on the record at 11:19 am.  Court address the parties regarding the jury instructions handed out to the parties.  Jurors will be allowed to ask questions during the trial.  Sequestation of witnesses is granted. Officer Pete Borchardt can stay in the courtroom.  Jurors are brought in at 11:28 am  Court reads the preliminary jury instructions  Openings statements at 11:37 am  Court takes a lunch break at 11:55 am and to be back at 1:00 pm.  Jurors are excused for lunch  

Defense Motion to impeach a state's witness it mute.  Defense attorney agrees.  

Court back in session at Jurors brought in at 1:04 pm.  Officer Peter Borchardt  duly sworn and testifies.  Court informs the jurors as to hearsay.  Id'd the deft in the courtroom.  Officer Dane Mathwich  duly sworn and testifies.  State rests.  Take a break and jurors are excused.  

Back on the record at 3:35 pm.  Defense enters a motions to dismiss the charge. Court denies  Back on the record jurors back in the courtroom.  3:59 pm.  Defense calls Russell Grefe  duly sworn and testifies.  A juror just informs the court that she knows the witness.  Court questions the juror.  We are able to proceed.   Jurors excused at 4:12 pm.  Court advises deft of rights to testify.  Deft will be testifing FVI.  Jurors back at

Attorney James A. Wedemeyer appeared on behalf of the deft.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 12:48 pm.  Appearances given.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Court puts the oral ruling on the record.
 
Court rules to grants the motion in regards to Flath and Martin with limitations.  The parenting skills of the victim will not be allowed.  No financial issues will be allowed into the trial.

Defendant Charles A Christopherson in court with attorney James A. Wedemeyer.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Defense motion to admit other act  Russell Grefe duly sworn and testifies.    Joann Flath  duly sworn and testifies.  Marie Martin duly sworn and testifies.  Officer Peter Borchardt  duly sworn and testifies.  Defense recalls Officer Borchardt.  Court hears oral arguements from parties.  Court would like to have the arguements in writing. within a week from today.(latest is noon on 5/17/16)
Defendant's Motion Admissibility of Other Crimes Evidence
admissibility of other crimes evidence - defense
Motion hearing on May 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Charles A Christopherson in court with attorney James A. Wedemeyer.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Defense motion to dismiss / seeking clarification.  Defense addresses the court regarding the motions.  Court addresses the parties.  Arguements heard.  State does not object to Count 2 being dismissed.  Court grants the request.  Court requests a recess and will be back on the record at 11:42 am.  Court gives ruling.  And denies the motion to dismiss.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Charles A Christopherson in court with attorney James A. Wedemeyer.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Defense motion to suppress Fruits of the search.  Defense requests sequestration of officers.  Pete Borchardt  duly sworn and testifies.  Dane Mathwich  duly sworn and testifies.  Back from a 5 min break at 10:58 am.  Charles A Christopherson  duly sworn and testifies. Recalling of Officer Dane Mathwich.  Recalling of Officer Pete Borchardt.  Court not going to take arguements today have run out of time.  Court requests letter briefs to be done.  State to have a letter brief by Friday 8/10/15.  Defense to have a letter brief by 8/21/15. Defendant Charles A Christopherson in court with attorney James A. Wedemeyer.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called and appearances given by the State.   Defense motion for Definite and Certain.  State's motion to amend the information(no motion filed - original was given to the court)  Arguements heard from the defense.  Court takes under advisement for time sequence for Count 1 with motion to suppress.  

Parties argue the amended information.  Court takes a break to review Statue Back on the record at 9:36 am  Court recits the statues that were reviewed.  Court rules the Motion by the state to amend the information is granted.   

Court adjourns the motion to for Definite and Certain to be heard with the suppress motions.  Jury trial to be removed.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:00 am.
